ratings.comment: Great prof. Nice woman. Passionate and helpful. Quite a lot of reading, but not too much other work. Lectures posted online

Professor McConnell is seriously amazing. She's so passionate and knowledgeable about basically everything having to do with animals. Getting an A also is very possible - I've never taken a zoo or biology class before and got an A. Reading and attending lectures won't be monitored exactly but both are musts. Highly recommend this class!

Amazing class! My favorite that I've taken so far here. McConnell is a great professor and makes the material so fun to learn. I was genuinely sad on the last day of lecture. Picky grading on papers and exams can be tricky, but the class is so worth it no matter the grade. Definitely take this if you can!

This class is VERY interesting. Definitely not hard to make myself go. A lot harder than I expected because I am not a Zoology major. You basically have to memorize everything covered because it is fair game on the exams. The work is worth taking the class though.

Prof McC was excellent!! By far the most enthralling classes of my college undergrad experience. If you love animals TAKE THIS CLASS. People who gave low ratings usually have very extreme animal views, or people who didn't do well in the class. This class not for slackers! The two exams and papers are complimentary to reflecting class material.
Amazing professor. Interesting concepts covered without biased opinions and I loved doing the readings. By far the best class I have ever taken in my college career!

I agree she is quite a good professor. But the exams and huge final paper were hard and both didn't really seem relevant to what we had actually been learning. The class is super interesting, but the testing and paper weren't fair.

This class was amazing! Took it because it sounded interesting and it has changed my outlook on how I look at animals. Prof McConnell definitely made this course and I honestly never wanted to miss lecture. You do definitely have to study but if you pay attention and actually are interested this class is very manageable.

Patty McC is the reason this course is so great. She is incredibly knowledgable, funny, and tuned into students' needs. Lectures are interesting, course is well-organized. Tests are detail-based so studying a lot is a good idea. Doing the readings is necessary. 2 exams, 2 papers, lectures are posted online but there's no reason not to attend!

I decided to take this class on a whim, and am so glad I did! Patricia is easily one of my favorite professors on campus and the class was by far my most interesting thus far. She's passionate about what she teaches and the exams are tough if you don't study and are uninterested. Coming to class was definitely not a chore. Will miss this class.

She is an amazing professor!  Keep in mind that this class isn't actually that easy though! You definitely have to do the readings and study the lecutre notes! I'm not a Zoo major nor have I taken any classes in this department, and I'm so happy that I have with Tricia. Take this class!!

Simply put, one of the best. If all my professors taught like her, going to class and doing well would not be a chore. Her exams are fair, but tough if you don't know the material from lecture, and her readings. Do the readings and go to class and this class shouldn't be a problem.

Just an absolute JOY to go to lecture with her.  She loves the stuff she talks about, and it's infectious.  She definitely cares about the students and she is incredibly easy to approach.  The sheep herding demonstration = very cool.  All around one of my favorite professors at Madison

Awesome Prof! The exams aren't super easy because they are all essay/short answer so you have to memorize a lot, but the class is super interesting and fun! She brings in dogs, we get to see sheep, have debates. Take this class!

Prof McConnell is one of the most approachable professors on campus I'm sure. She's very funny and really loves what she's doing. She has a cognitive-behaviorist business analyzing dog behavior problems and also a radio show. There's no better teacher for a class on human/animal relationships - a must take if you have any interest in the field!

I loved this class and prof.  I am a zoo major and very interested and knowledgeable in a lot of the material we covered so I didn't find the class extremely hard.  However...If you want to get a good grade you must attend lecture and take very good notes.  It is a fun class, all the demonstrations were just great.  Awesome prof.
One of the best prfoessors i've ever had...and one of the most inspiring. And I'm not even a zoo major.
I really like the class, but I'm not a zoo major so its kind of hard. VERY interesting tho.
